title: Presidental Nominations Sent to Senate, 9-25-09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




September 25, 2009

 



Presidental Nominations Sent to Senate, 9-25-09




THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary  _______________________________________________________  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE               September 25, 2009  NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE: Richard G. Callahan, of Missouri, to be United States Attorney for the Eastern District of Missouri for the term of four years, vice Catherine Lucille Hanaway. Michael W. Cotter, of Montana, to be United States Attorney for the District of Montana for the term of four years, vice William Walter Mercer. Robert R. King, of Virginia, to be Special Envoy on North Korean Human Rights Issues, with the rank of Ambassador. Nicholas A. Klinefeldt, of Iowa, to be United States Attorney for the Southern District of Iowa for the term of four years, vice Matthew G. Whitaker. Marisa Lago, of New York, to be an Assistant Secretary of the Treasury, vice Neel T. Kashkari, resigned. Stephanie M. Rose, of Iowa, to be United States Attorney for the Northern District of Iowa for the term of four years, vice Charles W. Larson, Sr., resigned. Laura Gore Ross, of New York, to be Alternate Representative of the United States of America to the Sixty-fourth Session of the General Assembly of the United Nations. # # #
